discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
These are the most important ones i think

questions.question_text: Which two options help you sell Cisco ISE? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Explaining ISE support for 3rd party network devices
choices.E: Discussing the importance of custom profiling
choices.C: Showcasing the entire ISE feature set
choices.D: Referring to TrustSec as being only supported on Cisco networks
choices.A: Downplaying the value of pxGrid as compared to RESTful APIs

questions.question_text: What statement is true regarding the current time in Enterprise Networking history?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I vote for A

questions.question_text: What are two characteristics of a migration from an IP-VPN service to a Cisco SD-WAN architecture? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/enterprise-networks/sd-wan/what-is-sd-wan.html#~benefits << security being mentioned specifically together with Better application experience. Cisco boasting about ngfw features and end to end security. “ Security where you need it
- when you need it #1 in threat intelligence from Talos*
SD-WAN with integrated cloud security, URL filtering, Advanced Malware Protection (AMP), Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) and Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS)”

I will agree on D because Cisco loves to say how well applications are handled by SD-WAN. C is a very marketed reason as well. So C,D. We have to remember that this is from a IP-VPN standpoint, so C will actually make quite a lot of sense.

Selected Answer: CD
Ill go for C,D. Ill take "Distributed control plane" as the control plane is not central. vSmart makes is central.

questions.question_text: What does the fabric data plane leverage in SD-Access Architecture?

discussion.content:
Answer is C
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/Campus/cisco-sda-design-guide.html#DataPlane

Refer SD Access operational plane > Data plane - VXLAN: VXLAN is a MAC-in-IP encapsulation method. It provides a way to carry lower-layer data across the higher Layer 3 infrastructure.

choices.B: IS-IS protocol to exchange link-state routing information
choices.A: LISP protocol to resolve endpoint-to-location mapping
choices.D: BGP protocol to advertise endpoint prefixes outside of the fabric
choices.C: MAC-in-IP encapsulation method to transport of the Layer 2 frame

questions.question_text: An architect is creating a migration strategy for a large organization in which the choice made by the application between IPv6 and IPv4 is based on the DNS request. Which migration strategy does the architect choose?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The transition is driven by DNS. If a dual-stacked device queries the name of a destination and DNS gives it an IPv4 address (a DNS A Record), it sends IPv4 packets. If DNS responds with an IPv6 address (a DNS AAAA Record), it sends IPv6 packets.
